title: UPSC CDS I Final Merit List Released; 590 Candidates Selected, Check Toppers List - News18
summary:
UPSC CDS I Final Merit List Released; 590 Candidates Selected

Date: January 08, 2025

Source: News18

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the CDS I final merit list for 2024. A total of 590 candidates have been shortlisted for the Combined Defence Services, with 470 selected for the men’s course and 120 for the women’s course.

  • A total of 590 candidates selected.
  • Top three male candidates: Ranbir Negi, Archit Chauhan, Devendra Sharma.
  • Top three female candidates: Divya, Pranjal Nangare, Mansi Basera.
  • Results available on upsc.gov.in.
  • Verification of DOB and educational qualifications will be conducted by Army Headquarters.
“The candidature of all the candidates is Provisional.” - UPSC

The release of the merit list marks a crucial step for candidates aspiring to join the Indian Armed Forces through the CDS examination.
newTitle: UPSC CDS I Final Merit List Released; 590 Candidates Selected

title: Boby Chemmanur arrested, Honey Rose's statement recorded - Onmanorama
summary:
Boby Chemmanur Arrested Following Honey Rose's Complaint

Published: January 08, 2025 07:45 PM IST

Updated: January 08, 2025 07:55 PM IST

Businessman Boby Chemmanur was arrested following actor Honey Rose's complaint of sexual harassment. Police confirmed his custody at the Ernakulam Central Police Station.

  • Boby Chemmanur arrested after allegations of sexual harassment by Honey Rose.
  • Honey Rose's statement was recorded by the Judicial Magistrate for over two hours.
  • Complaints detail incidents from a jewellery inauguration and public forums.
  • Around 20 YouTube channels are also facing complaints from Rose for defamatory content.
  • Chemmanur faces charges under IPC Section 75 and Section 67 of the IT Act.
“The specifics of Honey Rose's statement remain undisclosed but are critical for further charges.”

The investigation continues, with potential for additional charges against Chemmanur based on the findings regarding the allegations.
newTitle: Boby Chemmanur Arrested Following Honey Rose's Complaint

title: India’s foreign secretary meets Taliban minister for first time in Dubai - Hindustan Times
summary:
India’s foreign secretary meets Taliban minister for first time in Dubai

Date: January 8, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

India has pledged support for Afghanistan in the health sector and for refugee rehabilitation during a significant meeting between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Taliban’s Acting Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi in Dubai.

  • First official meeting between an Indian Foreign Secretary and a senior Taliban official.
  • India to provide material support to healthcare and refugee rehabilitation following a request from the Taliban.
  • Discussion included promoting Chabahar port for humanitarian assistance to Afghanistan.
  • India highlighted its historic friendship and commitment to the Afghan people.
“The Afghan side underlined its sensitivities to India’s security concerns.”

In conclusion, this meeting marks a pivotal step in India's engagement with the Taliban regime, opening pathways for humanitarian assistance while emphasizing security concerns.
newTitle: India's Foreign Secretary Engages with Taliban Minister for Humanitarian Support

title: PM Modi holds roadshow, unveils projects worth ₹2 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam - Hindustan Times
NLU grads, affluent persons keen to join judicial service: Supreme Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Notes Rising Interest in Judicial Careers Among NLU Graduates and Affluent Individuals

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 1:40 pm

The Supreme Court highlighted a growing demand for judicial service as a career, indicating that many graduates from National Law Universities (NLUs) are choosing to join the judiciary. The remarks were made during a plea concerning improvements in the service conditions of judges.

  • The Supreme Court noted an increase in NLU graduates entering the judiciary.
  • Justice Gavai commented on the interest of affluent individuals in judicial roles, linking it to the independence of the judiciary.
  • The Court raised concerns about inadequate pensions for district judges.
  • The matter was adjourned to February 21 for further hearings.
“Most NLU graduates immediately join the judiciary after graduation. People of affluent class today also want to join the judiciary. That has got something to do with the independence of the judiciary.” - Justice Gavai

The Supreme Court's observations underscore a significant trend in the judiciary's appeal among young legal professionals and the affluent, alongside ongoing discussions about judicial pay and benefits.
newTitle: Supreme Court Notes Rising Interest in Judicial Careers Among NLU Graduates and Affluent Individuals

title: One Nation, One Election meet: Opposition MPs question simultaneous polls, BJP members defend - Hindustan Times
summary:
One Nation, One Election meet: Opposition MPs question simultaneous polls, BJP members defend

Date: January 8, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The first meeting of the Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) on ‘One Nation, One Election’ bills featured a debate between opposition members and BJP MPs regarding the implications of simultaneous elections.

  • The JPC discussed the Constitution (129th Amendment) Bill and the Union Territories Laws (Amendment) Bill.
  • Opposition MPs, including Congress' Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, questioned the claim that simultaneous polls will reduce expenditure.
  • BJP members defended the bills, citing past instances of simultaneous polls and claiming public support for the idea.
  • Several opposition parties alleged that the proposed laws threaten federalism and undermine regional representation.
  • Concerns were raised about the impact on local issues and the engagement of elected representatives with their constituents.
“Upholding people's democratic rights is more important than saving money.” - TMC MP

The meeting highlighted significant divisions between government and opposition views on electoral reform and its effects on democratic processes in India.
newTitle: Opposition Questions Simultaneous Elections in Parliamentary Committee Meeting

title: Cricket, Security & Aid: What Foreign Secretary Misri Discussed With Taliban Minister In Dubai - News18
summary:
Cricket, Security & Aid: What Foreign Secretary Misri Discussed With Taliban Minister In Dubai

Date: January 09, 2025
Source: News18

Indian foreign secretary Vikram Misri met Taliban Defence Minister Muttaqi in Dubai on Wednesday, marking one of the first high-level meetings between New Delhi and the Taliban government in Afghanistan.

  • Discussion on India’s ongoing humanitarian assistance to Afghanistan.
  • Topics included bilateral issues and regional security situation.
  • India plans to promote trade and commerce, including through Chabahar port.
  • Support for health sector and rehabilitation of refugees discussed.
  • Cricket cooperation highlighted as popular among Afghan youth.
“India reiterated its commitment to continue to provide humanitarian & development assistance to the Afghan people.” – Randhir Jaiswal

This meeting comes amidst ongoing concerns about women's rights and the situation in Afghanistan, with India still considering whether to officially recognize the Taliban government.
newTitle: Cricket, Security & Aid: What Foreign Secretary Misri Discussed With Taliban Minister In Dubai

title: ‘Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4’: What Dr V Narayanan Said After Becoming New ISRO Chief - News18
summary:
Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

Date: January 08, 2025 | Source: News18

Rocket Scientist Dr V Narayanan has been appointed as the new chief of ISRO, expressing his commitment to improve the lives of Indians through technology and scientific advancements.

  • Dr V Narayanan considers his new role a great responsibility.
  • He has a clear plan for upcoming missions including Chandrayaan-4 and Gaganyan.
  • Dr Narayanan aims for advancements in climate studies, disaster management, communication, and earth observation.
  • His family expresses immense pride in his new position and contributions.
“Basically, the country needs a lot of things in terms of climate studies, disaster management system, communication requirements, satellites for communication, and earth observation.” – Dr V Narayanan

This appointment marks a hopeful new chapter for India's space aspirations as Dr Narayanan strives to enhance technology for societal benefit.
newTitle: Roadmap Clear For Chandrayaan-4: Insights from New ISRO Chief Dr V Narayanan

title: Modi govt shows Bangladesh its place, rejects Yunus govt demand to..., Sheikh Hasina gets reason to smile as... - India.com
summary:
India Rejects Bangladesh's Extradition Demand for Sheikh Hasina

Published on: [insert date] | Source: India.com

The Modi government in India has rejected Bangladesh's demand for the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina, amid allegations against her involving serious criminal accusations.

  • India has extended the visa of Sheikh Hasina, allowing her to stay in the country.
  • The interim government of Bangladesh has canceled the passports of 97 individuals, including Hasina.
  • There are ongoing investigations related to the kidnapping and murder allegations against these individuals.
  • The International Criminal Tribunal of Bangladesh has issued an arrest warrant for Sheikh Hasina.
"In India, Sheikh Hasina’s future is being discussed by experts of international affairs. The Centre has already cleared its stance, saying that the former prime minister will have to decide her future course of action."

This situation highlights the tensions between India and Bangladesh, as both countries navigate complex historical and political ties.
newTitle: India Rejects Bangladesh's Extradition Demand for Sheikh Hasina

title: Interim bail for Asaram Bapu: Security tightened for rape victim's family - The Hindu
summary:
Interim Bail for Asaram Bapu: Enhanced Security for Rape Victim's Family

Date: January 08, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

After Asaram Bapu was granted interim bail on medical grounds, security measures have been intensified for the family of his rape victim.

  • Asaram Bapu was granted interim bail by the Supreme Court until March 31, 2025.
  • The police have enhanced security at the victim's residence following the bail decision.
  • The victim's family expressed deep concerns for their safety, given Asaram's history of alleged orchestrating violence against witnesses.
  • Authorities are repairing CCTV cameras around the victim's house to ensure safety measures are updated.
  • Past incidents of violence linked to Asaram have raised alarms for the victim's family.
“I haven't been able to sleep since, as I am deeply concerned about my family's safety.” - Victim's father

The heightened security reflects the ongoing concerns surrounding Asaram Bapu's release and its implications for the victim's family.
newTitle: Interim Bail for Asaram Bapu: Enhanced Security for Rape Victim's Family

title: Passing comments on woman's "body structure" is sexual harassment: Kerala High Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Rules Comments on Women's Body Structure Constitute Sexual Harassment

Date: 08 Jan 2025

Source: Kerala High Court

The Kerala High Court recently declared that comments regarding a woman's 'body structure' can be considered sexual harassment, emphasizing the importance of protecting women's modesty.

  • The case involved remarks made by a man about a woman's body, which the court found to be inappropriate.
  • Justice A Badharudeen noted that such comments prima facie constitute sexual harassment under Sections 354A and 509 of the Indian Penal Code.
  • The court dismissed the accused's appeal to quash the proceedings against him, agreeing that the behaviour indicated a pattern of harassment.
“In the instant case the allegation of the prosecution is that the accused with intention to outrage the modesty of the defacto complainant...commented that the body structure of the defacto complainant was fine...”

The court's ruling highlights the judicial stance against sexual harassment and reinforces the notion that comments on a woman’s body can have serious legal implications.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Rules Comments on Women's Body Structure Constitute Sexual Harassment

title: PM Modi holds roadshow with CM Chandrababu Naidu and Pawan Kalyan in Vizag, to launch development project - The Times of India

PM Modi holds roadshow with CM Chandrababu Naidu and Pawan Kalyan in Vizag, to launch development projects for Andhra Pradesh

Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

Prime Minister Modi conducted a roadshow in Vizag accompanied by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu and actor-turned-politician Pawan Kalyan. The event marks the launch of several development projects aimed at enhancing the state's infrastructure.

  • PM Modi emphasized the government's commitment to Andhra Pradesh's development.
  • The roadshow attracted a large crowd demonstrating public support.
  • Key projects announced include improvements in transportation and urban infrastructure.
“The future of Andhra Pradesh is bright with these new projects.”

This roadshow signifies a strong political and developmental effort to further boost the growth trajectory of Andhra Pradesh.
newTitle: PM Modi Holds Roadshow in Vizag to Launch Development Projects

title: Nagpur couple dies by suicide after celebrating 28th marriage anniversary - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nagpur Couple Dies by Suicide After Their 28th Anniversary Celebration

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A couple from Nagpur, Maharashtra, tragically died by suicide shortly after celebrating their 28th wedding anniversary. The couple was reported to be facing financial difficulties and had no children.

  • The couple celebrated their anniversary late into the night with family and friends.
  • They recorded a video before their decision, which they shared on social media.
  • Two suicide notes were uploaded, requesting their properties be distributed without hassle.
  • The husband worked as a chef before financial difficulties led him to lend money on interest.
  • They were buried together at the Jaripatka Catholic cemetery.
“Discussing suicides can be triggering for some. However, suicides are preventable.”

This incident raises awareness about the importance of mental health support and suicide prevention resources available in India.
newTitle: Nagpur Couple Dies by Suicide After Their 28th Anniversary Celebration

title: ‘He never spoke about his cheeks’: Priyanka Gandhi reacts to Ramesh Bidhuri's remark - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Ramesh Bidhuri's 'Cheeks' Remark

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has criticized BJP leader Ramesh Bidhuri after his controversial remarks comparing roads to her cheeks. She stated that he never addressed his own cheeks and emphasized the importance of discussing real issues in elections.

  • Bidhuri sparked outrage with his remark about making assembly roads as smooth as Priyanka's cheeks.
  • His comments were labeled as 'distasteful' and 'sexist' by opposition leaders.
  • Priyanka Gandhi called the remarks 'ridiculous' and called for focus on significant electoral issues instead.
  • Other Congress leaders condemned Bidhuri for exhibiting an 'ugly mindset' towards women.
  • In response to the backlash, Bidhuri expressed regret but defended his comments by referencing similar remarks made by others in the past.
“He never spoke about his cheeks. All this is unnecessary. During the elections, we should talk about the important issues of the people of Delhi,” - Priyanka Gandhi

The incident highlights ongoing tensions and attitudes towards women in political discourse, prompting leaders to call for more respectful communication.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Responds to Ramesh Bidhuri's 'Cheeks' Remark

title: Is organizing protests sufficient to invoke UAPA? Delhi High Court asks police in Delhi riots case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court Questions Validity of UAPA in Protests Against CAA

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 11:54 am

The Delhi High Court is deliberating whether setting up protest sites against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act is sufficient for the police to invoke the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in the Delhi riots case.

  • The Court questioned the intent behind protests and whether the mere establishment of protest sites warrants UAPA.
  • Accused individuals, including Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, are seeking bail while the prosecution cites WhatsApp messages as evidence.
  • The Court demanded specific evidence indicating instigation of violence as opposed to mere organization of protests.
  • Observations were made regarding Delhi Police's selective naming of accused based on WhatsApp chats.
"Is it your case that only setting up of a protest site is good enough for UAPA or is it your case that protest site which resulted in a violence is good enough for a case under UAPA." - Justice Navin Chawla

The hearing continues as the Court examines the implications of the evidence presented by the prosecution.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Questions Validity of UAPA in Protests Against CAA

title: Formula E Race Case: Telangana High Court Permits KT Rama Rao's Lawyer To Watch ACB Interrogation Through ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Telangana High Court Allows KT Rama Rao's Lawyer to Observe ACB Interrogation in Formula E Case

Date: January 8, 2023 | Source: Live Law

The Telangana High Court has permitted BRS MLA KT Rama Rao's lawyer to observe the interrogation proceedings at the Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) in the Formula E race case. This ruling allows the lawyer to be present in a library opposite the interrogation room with visibility.

  • The court clarified that the presence of a lawyer during interrogation is not a fundamental right.
  • Justice K Lakshman stated that the lawyer could observe the proceedings from a library room with a glass window.
  • The investigating officer was directed to ensure the visibility for the lawyer.
  • The court dismissed Rao's plea to quash the FIR regarding alleged irregularities during his tenure as Urban Development Minister.
  • Rao's counsel referred to a Supreme Court judgment allowing a lawyer's presence at a visible distance during interrogations.
“What is the problem in permitting? Petitioner and Investigating Officer will be in one room. Advocate will sit in the visitor's room. Only thing is you have to provide him with some visibility.” - Justice K Lakshman

In conclusion, the court's decision aims to balance the rights of the accused with the investigative process, allowing for some level of lawyer supervision during the interrogation.
newTitle: Telangana High Court Allows KT Rama Rao's Lawyer to Observe ACB Interrogation in Formula E Case

title: Rajnath Singh reaffirms India's support to Maldives to boost defence preparedness - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rajnath Singh Strengthens India's Defense Ties with Maldives

Date: Jan 08, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh reaffirmed India's commitment to enhancing defense preparedness in the Maldives, underscoring the strategic partnership between the two nations.

  • During a recent meeting, India provided defense equipment to the Maldives at the request of the Muizzu government.
  • Both countries aim to strengthen their Comprehensive Economic and Maritime Security Partnership.
  • India offers support through capability enhancement, including training and infrastructure development.
  • The relationship experienced strain after Mohamed Muizzu's government demanded the withdrawal of Indian military personnel.
“India will continue to support the Maldives and the Maldives National Defence Force in their capacity-building efforts...” - Rajnath Singh

The ongoing collaboration indicates a potential restoration of trust and cooperation between India and the Maldives following recent diplomatic tensions.
newTitle: Rajnath Singh Strengthens India's Defense Ties with Maldives

title: Bhima Koregaon: Bombay High Court grants bail to Rona Wilson, Sudhir Dhawale - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bombay High Court Grants Bail to Rona Wilson and Sudhir Dhawale in Bhima Koregaon Case

Published on: 08 Jan 2025, 11:30 am

The Bombay High Court has granted bail to Rona Wilson and Sudhir Dhawale, two individuals accused in the 2018 Bhima Koregaon violence case, citing prolonged confinement and the need to examine numerous witnesses.

  • Bail granted on the condition of ₹1 lakh bail bonds.
  • Accused are required to report to the National Investigation Agency every Monday.
  • Court previously denied default bail to the accused in July 2024.
  • Wilson has been in custody since July 2018 under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act.
  • The Bhima Koregaon case originated from an event in 2017 that commemorated a significant clash involving Dalit soldiers.
“Prolonged incarceration, non-framing of charges, and the necessity to examine over 300 witnesses were key reasons for granting bail.”

In conclusion, the bail decision reflects ongoing judicial scrutiny of the lengthy detention of the accused in the wake of complex and significant legal narratives surrounding the Bhima Koregaon case.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Grants Bail to Rona Wilson and Sudhir Dhawale in Bhima Koregaon Case

title: Delhi election: Arvind Kejriwal accuses BJP of asking 7 MPs to make 'fake votes' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Attempting Electoral Fraud Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A day after the Election Commission ruled out the possibility of electoral roll manipulation, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of attempting to create fake votes ahead of the upcoming Delhi assembly elections.

  • Kejriwal claims BJP assigned targets to 7 MPs for creating fake votes.
  • Chief Minister Atishi plans to meet the Chief Election Commissioner regarding the allegations.
  • Election Commission dismisses charges of voter deletion and manipulation.
  • The Delhi assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, with counting on February 8.
“According to sources, the Gaali Galauj Party has given targets to its seven MPs to get fake votes made...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The upcoming elections have sparked significant controversy, with allegations of manipulation threatening the integrity of the voting process.
newTitle: Kejriwal Accuses BJP of Attempting Electoral Fraud Ahead of Delhi Elections

summary:
Delhi Man's Humorous Resignation Letter Goes Viral

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A resignation letter shared by Rishabh Singh, co-founder of EngineerHub, humorously encapsulates an employee's reason for leaving his job due to an inability to afford a smartphone, striking a chord among netizens.

  • The resignation letter started straightforwardly but soon displayed wit and humor.
  • The employee expressed disappointment over stagnant salary preventing him from buying the iQOO 13 smartphone.
  • He humorously questioned how his career would progress without the fastest phone in India.
  • The last working day was mentioned as December 4, 2024, with a note of appreciation for the company.
“After two wonderful years of dedication and hard work, it seems my salary has remained as frozen as my hopes for an increment.”

The resignation resonated widely online, generating laughter and empathy for its honesty, evidence of social media’s reaction with supportive comments.

title: J-K: Speedy trial run on 180-degree gradient added new chapter in Indian Railway, says CRS - Greater Kashmir
summary:
J-K: Speedy trial run on 180-degree gradient added new chapter in Indian Railway, says CRS

Date: January 8, 2023

Source: Jammu and Kashmir

The successful speed trial run on a 180-degree gradient from Katra to Banihal marks a significant milestone for the Indian Railways, indicating the potential for direct rail services to Kashmir.

  • The speed trial operated at 110 km/h, demonstrating the feasibility of rail connectivity in challenging geographical conditions.
  • Railway Safety Commissioner Dinesh Chand Deshwal emphasized the completion of the trial as a major achievement for railway engineers.
  • The trial run took about one and a half hours from Katra to Banihal and was part of the larger USBRL project.
  • This trial comes after the recent announcement regarding the completion of the Reasi-Katra section, an important development for Kashmir's connectivity.
  • Future decisions regarding the launch of services will depend on the completion of a statutory inspection and data analysis by the authorities.
“The trial run was smooth and filled us with a sense of fulfilment... the credit for it goes to our engineers who have done such a great work.” - Dinesh Chand Deshwal

This trial run is seen as a precursor to establishing direct rail services linking Kashmir with the rest of India after nearly three decades of efforts.
newTitle: Successful Speed Trial Marks New Chapter in Indian Railways

BJP slams AAP over standoff with police outside Delhi CM's house: 'Anarchy’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP Criticizes AAP Amid Police Standoff Outside CM's Residence

Date: Jan 08, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) condemned the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) after a confrontation between AAP leaders and Delhi Police outside the Chief Minister's bungalow, labeling it a "clear display of anarchy".

  • BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi criticized AAP's actions as irresponsible and anarchic.
  • AAP leaders Saurabh Bharadwaj and Sanjay Singh staged a dharna after being barred from entering the CM's residence.
  • The confrontation stems from AAP's response to allegations regarding the 'Sheesh Mahal' and its supposed corruption.
  • Delhi elections are set for February 5, with results announced on February 8.
“The reality of the monument of corruption is coming before the people... this is a clear display of anarchy,” said BJP MP Sudhanshu Trivedi.

This incident underscores the growing tensions between the BJP and AAP as elections approach, highlighting ongoing disputes over allegations of corruption.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes AAP Amid Police Standoff Outside CM's Residence

title: Domestic Violence Act Cases Have No Penal Consequence Except For Breach Of Protection Order: Supreme Court Criticises Issuance Of Bailable Warrants - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Criticizes Bailable Warrants in Domestic Violence Cases

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has criticized the issuance of bailable warrants by a Magistrate in cases under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005. The court noted that such warrants are unjustified as these cases are quasi-criminal proceedings.

  • The Court stated that bailable warrants should not be issued in domestic violence cases.
  • It emphasized that these proceedings do not carry penal consequences unless a protection order is violated.
  • The petitioner, who has a specially abled minor son and is unemployed, was subjected to unwarranted bailable warrants.
  • The case was transferred from Delhi to Ludhiana by the Supreme Court.
“This Court is constrained to observe that there is no justification whatsoever for the Trial Court to have issued bailable warrants...” - Justice Sandeep Mehta

In conclusion, the Supreme Court's remarks aim to clarify the appropriate handling of bailable warrants in cases concerning the Domestic Violence Act.
newTitle: Supreme Court Criticizes Bailable Warrants in Domestic Violence Cases

Sanjay Singh challenged the BJP to open the gates of Arvind Kejriwal’s ‘Sheesh Mahal’ to prove transparency.

This unfolding political drama is significant as the AAP seeks to maintain its governance amid increased scrutiny from the BJP.

During a temple event in Malappuram, an elephant exhibited violent behavior, swinging a man into the air with its trunk. This alarming incident has raised concerns about animal handling during public events.

title: Wrong spelling in ransom note helps police crack staged kidnapping in Hardoi - The Tribune India
